comments.body: maybe we should be able to craft them only when we make the achievment
fnf
And before you interpret what I am and many others are saying, no we nor I mean raise the cap from 28 chunks to 30 chunks. I mean full on unlock it to its max potential. Performance sacrificed or not
I’d even be on board with a more dynamic render range system. Example: fov based chunk rendering; within X range above the FOV set unload/load X amount of chunks

Your laptop CPU is better than Xbox CPUs. Yours runs 2.5 GHz (by default, though you can boost it up to 4.5 GHz). The Xbox One X's CPU runs at 2.3 GHz. Minecraft is far more CPU intensive than GPU intensive. Most people who experience performance issues when running Minecraft despite good hardware experience such problems because they made their computer good at rendering graphics, not general computations. That is exactly the problem Xbox's have when running Minecraft. Their graphics cards are fairly good, but their CPUs are low end, even compared to an average laptop. That's the secret of consoles. The reason they are cheaper than gaming PCs that can do the same games is they gave up features that a PC user would rarely be okay with giving up.

Your laptop will do better than any console I know anything about at virtually anything except gaming and AI.
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/28987273953933-We-hope-Minecraft-to-redo-the-enchantment-mechanism
This is not a good idea, Minecraft inventory is already way too small there is no need to make it smaller
Pls vote I thought about this a lot
This is more of a community server idea. There wouldnt much of a point to adding it officially.
It would also add a nice sense of environment if animals would flock to sources of water occasionally, especially in dry biomes like the savanna!

Minecraft definitely strikes a good balance currently, though these behaviours should expand include more mobs.

Will note that the player shouldn't be punished for AI interactions. Having an entire village killed off by zombie raids is never fun; a similar situation to all the animals around you dying because spawns weren't tipped to their favour.

Instead, the benefits should be strictly positive, rewarding the player for orchestrating the perfect environment for their animals. Whether that be the amount of item drops a player obtains from a well fed vs. malnourished animal, or how capable an animal is along the same gradient.

Sheep would be a good model for these mechanics, as their wool output is entirely dependent on the grass available around them.

Pets would require a little more tweaking, though I'd imagine a lot could be done by buffing a wolf's speed/attack when they're well fed.
I think adding this to villagers would also allow for building growth and a new challenge

It's nice that they added these to the cave vines in the new update but we desperately need these for normal vines too. I'd like to use vines in my build without having to trim them every five seconds.
Especially in the mangrove swamp it can get soo cluttered
Might be tricky, but doable, in multiplayer

@Nova "inkycatz" Barlow Nova before you start to delete this post I would like to say that sleeping in the daytime and sleeping when crops grow are completely different things. The player can make crops grow faster when they sleep at night time since players can only sleep at night time currently and not the daytime. I never mentioned that players could do this at daytime.

A suggestion on how to toggle:

If you have at least 18 dark prismarine block (that is, one dark prismarine block on each vertex and center, if you’d like to make the frame looks nice and symatrical), you wouldn’t have the night vision effect.

A few pistons will do the trick, if properly set.

@AvianXiphos77 You can use it for water travel through air faster, parkour and getting up onto boat docs and stuff!
Definitely not villagers.

I know it isn't a good idea in real life, but animal breeders do it anyways.  (Just watch a documentary on dog breeders where they talk about breeding a young dog with her grandfather to reinforce a trait they like)

 

The issue is that this isn't real life.  Genetics aren't a thing.  And it would be quite a pain to have to bring in "fresh blood" to be able to keep breeding your cows, especially when your cow farm has already taken up the passive mob cap and prevents any new cows from spawning nearby.
can't agree

we need to be able to breed them

 the villager thing i can understand but once a village has its normal amount of villagers the village can't spawn any more so they have to let breeding in the game

The problems with this argument: 

If you find the same animal type and put it on the farm, no-one would like to play a game called "find the one chicken that can be used to breed", and as the farm grows the more difficult it can be to manage.

Secondly, There will be a whole new family and gene system that the devs will need to implement to make this work. 

Finally, can't we just overlook our society's taboos and just remember this is a video game and we're all here to have fun. :D

The way genetics works, there is an extremely high chance of two genetically similar animals, such as siblings, of having a baby with significant birth defects.  I would like to explain it, but it would take too long.
And ur stuff gets put in a chest so it doesn't just disappear.
Download add-ons for mcpe then look for cannibalism
I absolutely love this idea, this is a great way of doing this, and it would keep the glow squid from getting hated on so much. I was really surprised when mojang didnt add this
Add this fr fr
We need this bro

The reason this hasn't been added, I think, is because of Mobile players. Since the devs can't find out how to implement the offhand system for Mobile, and Mobile isn't part of Bedrock Edition, they won't add it to Bedrock. They can't just have a feature on Bedrock only usable by console players, since Mobile players would also need to use it. Since Java is for PC only, they have no problem implementing the offhand feature into it.
I agree, the closest we have gotten is the /replaceitem command, but we want the item to be actually functional while in off hand. Also putting it there would be a huge help with multitasking.
They should at least make it so you can go into the inventory and put anything in the slot instead of only having certain items for it.
